Package socialmedia

Class Post

java.lang.Object
socialmedia.Post
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Comment, Endorsement
public class Post extends Object implements Serializable
Post class representing a post within the system. Each post is associated with an account that owns the post. Posts have incremental, unique identifiers, starting from 1, and keep track of their comments and endorsements.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Post

      public Post(Account account, String message)
      Constructs a new post on the system, associated with the given account.

      Assumes the message is a valid string

      Parameters:
      message - the message to be used on the comment
      account - the author of the comment

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      The method creates a string showing clearly the state of the attributes of the post class.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a String detailing posts attributes.

    • setCount

      public static void setCount(int n)
      The method sets the post class's counter to the given n value, meaning future identifiers will be set as n+1, and so on

      Using n=0 is the same as reseting the counter as if no posts exist yet Therfore you must be careful not to duplicate identifiers when using this method!

      Parameters:
      n - the number to start setting new identifers from

    • getIdentifier

      public int getIdentifier()
      The method gets the value of the private int identifier for the class.
      Returns:
      a int identifier for the post

    • getInfo

      public StringBuilder getInfo(int indent)
      The method returns the post information in a format ready to be displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      indent - the amount of indentation required infront of the information
      Returns:
      the StringBuilder object containing the formatted information

    • getChildInfo

      public void getChildInfo(StringBuilder postInfo, int indent)
      The method returns the post information for all child posts (comments) for the current post.

      Designed recursively, so will keep calling itself over and over again until all comments have been added to the stringBuilder

      Parameters:
      postInfo - the current stringBuilder that's been constructed so far
      indent - the amount of indentation required infront of the information
